abstract: A federal appeals court refused to reconsider an earlier decision upholding the process by which BP must compensate businesses claiming damages over the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill.
snippet: A federal appeals court refused to reconsider an earlier decision upholding the process by which BP must compensate businesses claiming damages over the 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court has refused to reconsider a major decision in the long-running battle over the 2010 gulf oil spill, leaving in place an earlier ruling that forces the British oil company BP to pay some businesses for economic damages without the businesses having to prove the losses were directly caused by the spill.

headline.main: Court Declines to Review Deal for Gulf Spill
headline.print_headline: Court Declines to Review Deal for Gulf Spill
